For the future, Castle Rock Vineyards now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Castle Rock Vineyards employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Castle Rock Vineyards will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

1.5	EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN

Castle Rock Vineyards' emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
-	California Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
-	Federal Emergency Action Plan - Title 29 CFR §1910.38 

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6	PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Castle Rock Vineyards has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Castle Rock Vineyards continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Castle Rock Vineyards' ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Castle Rock Vineyards' management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Castle Rock Vineyards has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Castle Rock V

h air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery room.

The ammonia system at this facility consists of equipment and vessels which are interconnected by piping. Therefore, the system is treated as a single process.

1.3	GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

1.3.1	GENERAL 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.
Castle Rock Vineyards has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program. 

1.3.2	ANHYDROUS AMMONIA

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Castle Rock Vineyards Plant 1 facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 46,000 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4	FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Castle Rock Vineyards has had no accidental releas

3.	Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary Castle Rock Vineyards employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Castle Rock Vineyards Plant 1 operates a commercial cold storage for table grapes in Delano, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(14) Storage Rooms
(4) Precool Rooms
(1) Repack Room
(1) Shipping Room
(3) Hallways
(1) Machinery Room

1.2.2 Facility Location

Castle Rock Vineyards Plant 1 is located at 501 Richgrove Dr, Delano, CA 93215. The latitude and longitude of the machinery room is 35.800052, -119.109746. The facility is located approximately 8 miles east of state highway 99, and it is surrounded on the east and north by housing and other businesses, and to the west by agricultural land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is not located in “a special flood hazard area”.
Castle Rock Vineyards Plant 1 is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk:
Great Valley Thrust Fault System: <150 years
Pond Fault: <150 years
Kern Front Fault: <150 years
Premier Fault: <150 years

With regard to USGS Quaternary Faults, the threat of fault rupture is low. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Castle Rock Vineyards Plant 1 has a 2-5% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.

1	EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
-	California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
-	Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
-	California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
-	Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Castle Rock Vineyards has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1	CASTLE ROCK VINEYARDS, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM 

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Castle Rock Vineyards has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name 	Process Chemical	Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia	        Ammonia               	46,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.

Castle Rock Vineyards has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:
